result.name: personal-independence-payment
result.notes: Personal Independence Payment was introduced in April 2013 and has started to replace Disability Living Allowance for disabled people aged 16 to 64. The information recorded includes Name, National Insurance Number, Address, claim details, payment history, medical information.

organization.name: department-for-work-and-pensions
organization.title: Department for Work and Pensions
organization.description:
The Department for Work and Pensions (DWP) is responsible for welfare and pension policy and is a key player in tackling child poverty. It is the biggest public service delivery department in the UK and serves over 20 million customers.

DWP is a ministerial department, supported by 13 agencies and public bodies.

https://www.gov.uk/government/organisations/department-for-work-pensions

result.title: Personal Independence Payment

extras.value:
https://www.gov.uk/pip    Not due to be released as this contains personal and sensitive data. We will review this in the light of demand and prioritisation. We do publish Official Statistics on PIP from Spring 2014 aligned to the DLA National Statistics release. You can access PIP statistics using Stat-Xplore a tool to allow you to explore our statistics and 
•	create customised tabulations
•	view results in interactive charts
•	share outputs via social networking tools or download into common file formats. https://stat-xplore.dwp.gov.uk/
